message_1:
Calculate the standard electrode potential for the following half-reaction: 

Cu2+(aq) + 2e- --> Cu(s) 

given that the standard reduction potential for Cu2+(aq) is +0.34 V.
message_2:
The standard electrode potential for the given half-reaction is the same as the standard reduction potential since the reaction is already written as a reduction. Therefore, the standard electrode potential for the half-reaction:

Cu2+(aq) + 2e- --> Cu(s)

is +0.34 V.
